content.description: First 2 moves and clipping the second bolt is sketchy, with painful knife edges on the fingers; remainder of route is not at all challenging.
content.location: Immediately left of Hole in the Wall (eventually the 2 routes blend together). Route is right (around the corner) of Beat Farmer 11c. Start is on the obvious 2 foot wide broken flake.

climbs.name: More on the Mark (aka Squeeze Job)

content.description: Fun, technical route. Crux is the first 2 bolts, but still fairly sustained.
content.protection: Bolts. Bolted anchor without rap rings, but hangers are thick enough to still rap and pull the rope through without harming the rope.
content.location: Same start as Aurora 11d, but trends right along a short finger crack. Route is right of Aurora and left of Beat Farmer 11c. Pretty much in the middle of the main vertical wall.

content.description: This starts in a light colored rock scar, left of "Faux Bro". Move past two closely placed bolts, then through some holes and two more bolts to the anchor.
Easy climbing to first bolt, crux move past the second bolt. Short but route leads to chained anchors, all hard wear on this route very old.
content.location: Left of Welcome to Fresno Dome.

climbs.name: Beat Farmer
climbs.fa: Lavon Weighall and Mark Spencer, October 1987

content.description:
Climb the vertical face using crimps, sidepulls, and pockets.  Pull onto the slab and continue straight up to anchors shared with Faux Bro and Hole in the Wall.

The second and third bolt are old and rusty.  Once you get past the third bolt onto the slab/low angle face, a fall before the fourth bolt would take you very close to the ground - if the third bolt holds. Be careful.
content.protection: All bolts have been replaced with 1/2” stainless hardware.
content.location: Rightmost route on vertical face.  Third from the right total.

content.description: Start with a good pocket, continue up and slight right following a crack.  Pull onto the slab/low angle face and continue to the anchors.
content.location: Fourth route from the right. Center of the face.

climbs.name: Breakthrough and Conquer (aka Welcome to Fresno Dome)

content.description: Fun and beautiful route. Crux is the first bolt. Begin with a bomber undercling.
content.protection: Bolts. Optional 0.2 Camalot in the undercling before the first bolt to help prevent ground strike. Rap rings on bolted anchor.
content.location: First bolt is above obvious giant undercling flake that is about 7 feet above ground; a group of bushes/small trees is growing immediately to its right at the base of the rock (same group of bushes that the trail walks through). Route is immediately right of The Eliminator 5.9 crack.

content.description: This climbs face passing five Bolts, on the far right of the cliff. Just right of "Hole in the wall" and shares the same anchor.
